cont.entity_a: Small enough to travel in a large purse.
Offers more control than digital devices.
Performs flawlessly with much higher quality results than the Kodak P850.
cont.entity_b: Performs well in harsh lighting conditions, comparable to modern cell phones.

cont.entity_a: Built-in anti-shake is a must-have feature, superior to expensive anti-shake lenses.
cont.entity_b: Solid and functional body with no extra features.

cont.entity_a: Sanyo eneloop rechargeables work great, avoiding high self-discharge rates.
cont.entity_b: Battery life is amazing, even after taking many raw format photos.

cont.entity_a: Compatible with older K lenses with electronic dots on the inside ring.
cont.entity_b: Works with all Nikon lenses, including old film AF and manual lenses.

cont.entity_a: Offers comparable features to Nikon and Canon at a fraction of the cost.
cont.entity_b: Worth the extra money over the D40.

cont.entity_a: Transition to DSLR is clean and effortless with the K100D.
Can take any K mount lens and work in manual mode.
18-55mm kit lens offers high quality for little cash.
Durable, having lasted many years and still works perfectly.
cont.entity_b: Camera body is in excellent condition.

cont.entity_a: 6MP is small by today's standards but offers great value for entry-level DSLR.
cont.entity_b: 6MP APS-C sensor is among the best for its resolution.

cont.entity_a: Provides excellent picture quality, especially for outdoor results.
cont.entity_b: Image quality is crisp and clear, with low noise at ISO 200.

cont.entity_a: User-friendly with an array of auto features and modes.
Great value for money with the option to use rebate for additional lens.
Easy to use and sturdy.
Shake reduction feature is very effective. Image stabilization feature is impressive.
Auto-focus is generally fast.
Bombproof construction, compatible with many K-mount and M42 screw mount lenses.
cont.entity_b: Dependable and well-made camera for beginners.

cont.entity_a: Good color fidelity and performs well in low light.
cont.entity_b: Color capture sensor is accurate and matches well with Fuji Frontier printer.

cont.entity_a: Shutter speed is excellent.
cont.entity_b: Synchronizes to 1/500 sec in flash mode with external Nikon flash.

cont.entity_a: Loud shutter sound and LCD screen display issues.
Limited buffer size for consecutive shots.
No memory card included, requires separate purchase.
Image quality is stunning and superior to point-and-shoot cameras.
AA batteries offer convenience.
Limited white balance adjustment needed indoors.
Great starter DSLR with excellent image quality.
cont.entity_b: Great entry-level DSLR with many features and manual settings.

cont.entity_a: Auto-focus has occasional difficulty with skyward subjects.
High quality construction with a nice feel.
Camera body is well-built with quality construction.
cont.entity_b: Camera and lens were well protected and in good condition.
Some functions did not work as expected.
Connection problems in the body, difficult to fix.
